page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY ....EVENTS.
page.content: APPLEDORE, SMALL AS IT HAS ALWAYS BEEN,HAS PLAYED IT'S PART IN MANY EVENTS OF NATIONAL IMPORTANCE.THE DANISH INVASION FLEET IN 892 MADE IT THE BASE OF ATTACKS ON THE REST OF ENGLAND. IN 138O THE FRENCH BURNED APPLEDORE. NEXT YEAR CAME THE PEASENTS REVOLT. IN 145O JACK CADE'S MEN MARCHED THROUGH. IN 18O5 THE ROYAL MILITARY CANAL WAS BUILT WHEN NAPOLEON THREATENED INVASION. IN EARLY DAYS APPLEDORE WAS A CONSIDERABLE TRADING CENTRE,WITH A WEEKLY MARKET AND AN ANNUAL FAIR. THE SILTING OF THE OLD ROTHER CHANNEL REDUCED TRADE BUT IT STILL HAS ACCESS TO THE SEA. MANY APPLEDORE TRADESMEN FLOURISHED AND PROVIDED EMPLOYMENT.
